items.title: Farmsafe Australia issues warning after two serious hay bale incidents

items.summary: In the 1960s, the last of the desert families were coming into contact with white people. For one woman, the moment was captured on camera.

items.title: What life's like when you're Deaf and blind
items.summary: Living with vision impairment throws up many challenges. Being Deaf on top of that requires you to go to even greater lengths just to fit in with the modern world. This is how one Deafblind woman does it.

items.title: How pregnancy is being criminalised in post-Roe America
items.summary: In the wake of widespread abortion bans, US prosecutors launch hundreds of cases charging people with crimes related to their pregnancy, miscarriage, stillbirth or birth.

items.title: Gearing up for the school holidays? Here's how to survive them without social media
items.summary: These school holidays, children under 16 will find themselves with less social media access as a ban comes into place. We asked the experts how parents can best support their kids with the transition.

items.title: Hard Quiz: So, you think you're good at quizzes? It's time to play HARD!
items.summary: Alright, show us what you've got. I'll keep my expectations low.

items.title: Politicians in South-East Asia ignore climate change at their own political peril

items.title: Opposition to social media ban scores minor political points at best
items.summary: Australia's social media age ban is one of the most significant attempts to rebalance the asymmetric power relationship between government and tech.

items.title: Overnight fire exchange at Afghan-Pakistan border kills five and wounds eight, officials say

items.title: Not all babies need a hepatitis B shot at birth, US vaccine advisers say
items.summary: President Donald Trump is calling the vote a "very good decision" after US vaccine advisers recommended ending the universal hepatitis B shots at birth.

items.title: Teen seriously injured in e-bike crash in Claremont after e-rideables inquiry called for widespread changes
items.summary: A 14-year-old boy suffers serious injuries in an e-bike crash in Perth's western suburbs, just two days after a parliamentary inquiry into WA's e-rideable laws made 33 recommendations in a bid to make the devices safer.

items.summary: While police say the investigation is over, the local community is still trying to move forward from the devastation.

items.summary: The gothic vampire period drama Sinners has topped the Critics' Choice Movie Awards, securing 17 nods, followed by One Battle After Another with 14.

items.summary: The Trump administration releases a document saying its goal is to "help Europe correct its current trajectory", adding that it faces "civilisational erasure" due in part to "mass migration".

items.summary: Nothing can be guaranteed in a World Cup, but the Socceroos' draw alongside the United States, Paraguay and a European qualifier gives a solid shot at advancing, with the Australians avoiding most of the big names.

items.title: Residents still unable to return home as north-east Victoria bushfire continues

items.title: It's been a tumultuous time for SA's Liberals — they now need to find another new leader
